text: Job growth continued to slow in September, as fading government support and the failure to contain the coronavirus threatened to short-circuit a once-promising recovery. The economy has regained just over half of the jobs lost earlier this year. https://t.co/s7zgAmCecX

name: nytimes
text: In September, employers added 661,000 jobs, according to Friday's monthly labor report. If this rate of job creation were to be sustained indefinitely, it would take another 17 months for the economy to be back to its pre-pandemic levels of employment. https://t.co/VaiGhNjLiq

name: nytimes
text:

https://t.co/h6jFvoYvUf
